qas.question: What English school offers Sanskrit as a language study?
Since what date has Sanskrit been offered as a language option in the U.S.?
What is the credit towards in study in the U.S.?
Who coordinates the study program of Samskritam as a Foreign Language?
What school in Australia offers Sanskrit as a study?
What does St. Johns Junior School in London offer?
Where have high school students been allowed to receive credits toward a Foreign Language since 2006?
What school years in Australia are students required to study Sanskrit?
Who coordinated Sanskrit as a foreign language?
What does a student get at the Sydney private middle school for studying Sanskrit?

context: <a0_0>St James Junior School<a0_0/> in London, England, offers <b5_0>Sanskrit<b5_0/> as part of the curriculum. In the <b6_0>United States<b6_0/>, since <a1_0>September 2009<a1_0/>, high school students have been able to receive credits as Independent Study or toward <a2_0>Foreign Language<a2_0/> requirements by studying Sanskrit, as part of the "SAFL: Samskritam as a Foreign Language" program coordinated by <a3_0><b8_0>Samskrita Bharati<b8_0/>.<a3_0/> In Australia, the Sydney private boys' high school <a4_0>Sydney Grammar School<a4_0/> offers Sanskrit <b7_0>from years 7 through to 12<b7_0/>, including for the <b9_0>Higher School Certificate<b9_0/>.
